The Likert scale is a type of data-collection technique that is used in survey research particularly in social sciences. It is a rating scale technique that measures the strength of agreement or disagreement with a statement.  The Likert scale typically ranges from 1 to 5 or 1 to 7 where 1 represents strong disagreement and 7 represents strong agreement. The Trolley Problem  The Trolley Problem is a thought experiment in philosophy that presents a dilemma about whether it is ever morally acceptable to break a less serious rule in order to avoid a more serious one. The scenario typically involves a runaway trolley that is headed towards a group of five people who will be killed if the trolley continues on its current path. The person presented with this dilemma has the option to switch the trolley to a different track but in doing so one person on that track will be killed.  In this scenario which option do you choose?
